title: Banking Culture: Still room for improvement?
text:
Banking Culture: Still room for improvement? 4:17am IST - 61:30 
Since the great economic crisis, regulators have imposed new rules designed to ensure financial institutions pursue strategies that acknowledge their purpose as important stewards of ethical and inclusive behavior.Our panel includes three of the foremost thinkers on the matter, New York Federal Reserve President William C. Dudley and William Rhodes, co-chair of the G30's steering committee on bank culture and governance. ▲ Hide Transcript ▶ View Transcript 
Since the great economic crisis, regulators have imposed new rules designed to ensure financial institutions pursue strategies that acknowledge their purpose as important stewards of ethical and inclusive behavior. Our panel includes three of the foremost thinkers on the matter, New York Federal Reserve President William C. Dudley and William Rhodes, co-chair of the G30's steering committee on bank culture and governance.
